title: A Trip along the Murray River
other_title: A Trip from Swan Hill to Murray Bridge
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Irrigation - Murray River Region (N.S.W.-S. Aust.)
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Murray River (N.S.W.-S. Aust.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Rivers - Victoria
abstract: Surveying the settlements, townships and arable lands along the path of the Murray River, this silent documentary emphasises the river’s significance in Australia’s agricultural and natural history.
description: Made at a time when reservoirs, pumping plants, weirs, and channels were still being constructed to harness the Murray River’s water supply for irrigation and agriculture, this documentary is both a record of construction and also evidence of how irrigation has transformed the lands surrounding the Murray. Harnessing the Murray’s water flow allowed thousands of acres of formerly useless land to be reclaimed for cultivation.
